feed.title: Password Pusher Releases
feed.subtitle: Self-hosted software releases generated by selfh.st

entry.title: New release for Password Pusher: v1.53.8: Dependency & Security Updates
entry.content:
:memo: What’s Changed

  • Docker Compose: Updates (#3279) @pglombardo

:arrow_up: Dependencies updates

  • Bundle Security & Dependency Updates (#3288) @pglombardo
  • :arrow_up: Bump nokogiri from 1.18.7 to 1.18.8 (#3287) @dependabot[bot]
  • :arrow_up: Bump google-cloud-storage from 1.55.0 to 1.56.0 (#3286) @dependabot[bot]
  • :arrow_up: Bump stringio from 3.1.6 to 3.1.7 (#3285) @dependabot[bot]
  • :arrow_up: Bump aws-partitions from 1.1089.0 to 1.1090.0 (#3284) @dependabot[bot]
  • :arrow_up: Bump solid_queue from 1.1.4 to 1.1.5 (#3282) @dependabot[bot]
  • :arrow_up: Bump sprockets from 4.2.1 to 4.2.2 (#3281) @dependabot[bot]
  • :arrow_up: Bump ruby from 3.4.2-alpine to 3.4.3-alpine in /containers/docker (#3280) @dependabot[bot]
  • :arrow_up: Bump aws-partitions from 1.1088.0 to 1.1089.0 (#3278) @dependabot[bot]

:busts_in_silhouette: List of contributors

@dependabot[bot], @pglombardo and dependabot[bot]

:motor_boat: Docker Images

Available on Docker Hub: https://hub.docker.com/r/pglombardo/pwpush

:running_man: Run This Version

bash docker run -d -p 5100:5100 pglombardo/pwpush:1.53.8

..and go to http://localhost:5100

entry.title: New release for Password Pusher: v1.53.9: Latest Language Strings & New Analytics Support
entry.content:
Big updates to the Ukrainian language strings thanks to @SystemNickDev!

Added support for @plausible analytics (Plausible.io) with configuration docs.

:memo: What’s Changed

:rocket: Features

  • Latest Language Strings (#3322) @pglombardo
  • Add Plausible Analytics Support (#3296) @pglombardo

:arrow_up: Dependencies updates

  • :arrow_up: Bump aws-sdk-core from 3.222.3 to 3.223.0 (#3319) @dependabot[bot]

entry.title: New release for Password Pusher: v1.53.11: Dependency Updates: Development Environment Improvements
entry.content:
Thanks to @ozovalihasan for his first contributions in this release. Great work!

:memo: What’s Changed

  • Add a default host for emails sent/shown locally (#3344) @ozovalihasan
  • Add the yarn version used by corepack (#3341) @ozovalihasan

:rocket: Features

  • Development: Use /mailbin for email (#3342) @pglombardo
  • Themes: Remove selected.css; generated on boot (#3338) @pglombardo
  • Add a .ruby-version file (#3339) @ozovalihasan

:arrow_up: Dependencies updates

  • :arrow_up: Bump psych from 5.2.5 to 5.2.6 (#3347) @dependabot[bot]
  • :arrow_up: Bump mini_portile2 from 2.8.8 to 2.8.9 (#3346) @dependabot[bot]
  • :arrow_up: Bump aws-partitions from 1.1102.0 to 1.1103.0 (#3345) @dependabot[bot]
  • Update ruby version bundling gems (#3343) @ozovalihasan
  • :arrow_up: Bump psych from 5.2.4 to 5.2.5 (#3335) @dependabot[bot]
  • :arrow_up: Bump aws-partitions from 1.1101.0 to 1.1102.0 (#3334) @dependabot[bot]

:busts_in_silhouette: List of contributors

@dependabot[bot], @ozovalihasan, @pglombardo and dependabot[bot]

Available on Docker Hub: https://hub.docker.com/r/pglombardo/pwpush

entry.title: New release for Password Pusher: v1.54.0: (New) Name Your Pushes
entry.content:
You can now add a name to your pushes. These names are currently used in the dashboard but will eventually be used in notifications & emails.

This feature comes from the Premium edition on pwpush.com and should hopefully help in organizing your pushes.

BTW this new field is fully supported in the JSON API too!

This new functionality was put together by @ozovalihasan. Thanks for the great work!

:memo: What’s Changed

  • Add name to pushes (#3351) @ozovalihasan

:arrow_up: Dependencies updates

  • :arrow_up: Bump aws-sdk-s3 from 1.185.0 to 1.186.0 (#3348) @dependabot[bot]
  • :arrow_up: Bump aws-sdk-kms from 1.100.0 to 1.101.0 (#3350) @dependabot[bot]
  • :arrow_up: Bump aws-sdk-core from 3.223.0 to 3.224.0 (#3349) @dependabot[bot]
  • :arrow_up: Bump standard from 1.49.0 to 1.50.0 (#3354) @dependabot[bot]

:busts_in_silhouette: List of contributors

@dependabot[bot], @ozovalihasan, @pglombardo and dependabot[bot]

Available on Docker Hub: https://hub.docker.com/r/pglombardo/pwpush

:running_man: Run This Version
